```{r, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# =======================
# CLEAN ENVIRONMENT
# =======================
rm(list = ls())

# =======================
# LOAD LIBRARIES
# =======================
library(knitr)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
library(gridExtra)

# =======================
# LOAD DATA
# =======================
data <- read.csv("MA334-AU-7_2501629.csv")

# =======================
# SECTION 1: DATA EXPLORATION
# =======================
cat("# 1. Data Exploration\n\n")

cat("## (a) Summary of the Data Set\n\n")

kable(head(data, 2), caption = "First Two Observations")

kable(
  data.frame(
    Item = c("Total Observations", "Total Variables"),
    Value = c(nrow(data), ncol(data))
  ),
  caption = "Dataset Dimensions"
)

cat("\n**Interpretation:**  \n")
cat(
  paste0(
    "The dataset contains **",
    nrow(data),
    " observations** and **",
    ncol(data),
    " variables**, which is sufficient for reliable statistical analysis.\n\n"
  )
)

# =======================
# VARIABLE TYPES
# =======================
cat("## (b) Variable Types\n\n")

var_types <- data.frame(
  Variable = names(data),
  Data_Type = sapply(data, class)
)

kable(var_types, caption = "Variable Data Types")

cat("\n**Interpretation:**  \n")
cat(
  "Numeric variables are suitable for statistical modelling, while categorical variables help in group-based comparisons.\n\n"
)

# =======================
# MISSING VALUES
# =======================
cat("## (c) Missing Values\n\n")

missing_values <- data.frame(
  Variable = names(data),
  Missing_Count = sapply(data, function(x) sum(is.na(x)))
)

kable(missing_values, caption = "Missing Values Summary")

cat("\n**Interpretation:**  \n")
cat(
  "Variables with missing values may require cleaning or careful handling before further analysis.\n\n"
)

# =======================
# SIDE-BY-SIDE PLOTS
# =======================
cat("## (d) Distribution Plots\n\n")

p1 <- ggplot(data, aes(x = price)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 30) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Price", x = "Price", y = "Frequency")

p2 <- ggplot(data, aes(x = carat)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 30) +
  labs(title = "Distribution of Carat", x = "Carat", y = "Frequency")

grid.arrange(p1, p2, ncol = 2)

cat("\n**Interpretation:**  \n")
cat(
  "Both variables show skewed distributions, suggesting that logarithmic transformation may be useful in regression analysis.\n\n"
)

# =======================
# SUMMARY STATISTICS
# =======================
cat("## (e) Summary Statistics\n\n")

kable(summary(data), caption = "Summary Statistics")

cat("\n**Interpretation:**  \n")
cat(
  "The summary statistics describe the central tendency and variability of the variables, helping identify outliers and overall data behaviour.\n"
)
